record.name: Account Manager
record.description: An Account Manager is responsible for managing customer relationships and ensuring satisfaction. They handle sales, support, and communication to drive business growth.

record.name: Sales Manager
record.description: A Sales Manager oversees the sales team, sets targets, and develops strategies to increase revenue. They manage customer relationships and ensure that sales goals are met.

record.name: Stakeholder
record.description: A Stakeholder is any individual or organization that has an interest in a project. They provide requirements, feedback, and approval for the project.

record.name: Investor
record.description: An Investor provides financial support to a project or organization. They may have a say in strategic decisions and expect returns on their investment.

record.name: Product Owner
record.description: A Product Owner represents the voice of the customer in a development team. They are responsible for defining product vision, managing the product backlog, and ensuring that the developed product meets customer needs and business goals.

record.name: Project Manager
record.description: A Project Manager is responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects. They manage resources, ensure timelines are met, and communicate effectively with stakeholders to deliver successful outcomes.

record.name: Scrum Master
record.description: A Scrum Master facilitates the Agile development process by ensuring that teams follow Scrum principles and practices. They remove obstacles, promote collaboration, and help the team achieve its goals.

record.name: Program Manager
record.description: A Program Manager is responsible for managing multiple projects or a large-scale program. They coordinate resources across different teams, ensure alignment with business goals, and manage risks to deliver successful outcomes.

record.name: Release Manager
record.description: A Release Manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing software releases. They ensure that the release process is smooth, timely, and meets quality standards while communicating with stakeholders.

record.name: Solution Architect
record.description: A Solution Architect is responsible for designing and overseeing the implementation of complex IT solutions that meet business requirements. They work closely with stakeholders to understand needs, design scalable architectures, and ensure successful deployment.

record.name: System Architect
record.description: A System Architect designs and oversees the implementation of IT systems that meet business needs. They ensure scalability, security, and performance while working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements.

record.name: Enterprise Architect
record.description: An Enterprise Architect is responsible for designing and implementing IT strategies that align with business goals. They work across the organization to ensure consistency, scalability, and integration of systems.

record.name: Business Analyst
record.description: A Business Analyst acts as a bridge between business stakeholders and IT teams. They gather requirements, analyze processes, and document solutions to improve business efficiency and effectiveness.

record.name: System Analyst
record.description: A System Analyst analyzes existing systems and processes to identify areas for improvement. They gather requirements, document solutions, and work with developers to implement changes that enhance system performance and user experience.

record.name: Data Analyst
record.description: A Data Analyst collects, processes, and performs statistical analysis on large sets of data. They help organizations make informed decisions by identifying trends and insights.

record.name: Solution Manager
record.description: Solution Management is the function responsible for defining desirable, viable, feasible, and sustainable large solutions that meet customer needs and for supporting development across the solution life cycle.

record.name: Solutions Engineer (STE)
record.description: The Solution Train Engineer (STE) is a servant leader and coach who facilitates Solution Train events and processes, coordinates the work of ARTs and Suppliers, and supports ARTs in delivering value.

record.name: Release Train Engineer (RTE)
record.description: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) is a servant leader and ART coach who facilitates ART events and processes, and supports teams in delivering value.

record.name: Technical Lead
record.description: A Technical Lead is responsible for guiding a team of developers. They provide technical direction, manage project timelines, and ensure that projects meet quality standards.

record.name: Team Lead
record.description: A Team Lead manages a team of software developers, ensuring that they are productive and working towards common goals. They also handle communication between the development team and other stakeholders.

record.name: Back-end Developer
record.description: A Back-end Developer is responsible for the server-side logic of a web application. They write code that handles data storage, retrieval, and manipulation, ensuring that the back-end functions smoothly.

record.name: Front-end Developer
record.description: A Front-end Developer is responsible for creating the user interface of a web application. They use technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build interactive and responsive designs.

record.name: Full-stack Developer
record.description: A Full-stack Developer is proficient in both front-end and back-end development. They can handle the entire web application lifecycle, from design to deployment.

record.name: Quality Assurance Engineer
record.description: A Quality Assurance Engineer ensures that software products meet quality standards before release. They design and execute test plans, identify bugs, and work with developers to resolve issues.

record.name: QA Automation Engineer
record.description: A QA Automation Engineer focuses on automating the testing process to improve efficiency and coverage. They write scripts and tools that can automatically test software applications.

record.name: QA Manager
record.description: A QA Manager oversees the quality assurance team. They set standards, manage resources, and ensure that all testing activities are aligned with project goals.

record.name: QA Tester
record.description: A QA Tester manually tests software applications to identify and report bugs. They follow test plans and document their findings.

record.name: DevOps Engineer
record.description: A DevOps Engineer bridges the gap between development and operations. They automate processes, manage infrastructure, and ensure smooth deployment of applications.

record.name: Site Reliability Engineer
record.description: An SRE focuses on maintaining the reliability of production systems. They work to ensure that services are available, performant, and scalable.

record.name: Cloud Engineer
record.description: A Cloud Engineer specializes in designing, building, and maintaining cloud-based infrastructure. They work with various cloud platforms to deploy applications and manage resources efficiently.

record.name: Automation Engineer
record.description: An Automation Engineer focuses on automating repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and reduce errors. They develop scripts, tools, and processes for automation in various stages of the software development lifecycle.

record.name: User Experience Designer
record.description: A User Experience Designer focuses on creating intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. They conduct research, design prototypes, and iterate based on feedback to enhance the overall user experience.

record.name: User Interface Designer
record.description: A User Interface Designer creates the visual elements of an application or website. They focus on aesthetics, usability, and consistency to ensure a seamless user experience.

record.name: Graphic Designer
record.description: A Graphic Designer creates visual content for various media, including print and digital. They use design software to produce graphics that communicate a message or enhance the aesthetic appeal of a product.

record.name: Interaction Designer
record.description: An Interaction Designer focuses on the behavior of interactive systems. They design interactions between users and products to ensure they are effective, efficient, and enjoyable.

record.name: User Experience Researcher
record.description: A User Experience Researcher studies user needs, behaviors, and preferences to inform the design of products. They conduct research through methods such as surveys, interviews, and usability testing.
